18  35 4. Uniform Circular Motion 1. Position, Velocity, and Acceleration Vectors 2. Two-dimensional motion with constant acceleration 3. Projectile motion 4. Uniform circular motion 5. Relative motion Uniform Circular Motion 0 Uniform circular motion occurs when an object moves in a circular path with a constant speed. 0 The velocity vector is always tangent to the path of the object. 0 An acceleration exists since the direction of the motion is changing, and the acceleration is perpendicular
changing, and the acceleration is perpendicular to the path. 36

vector is given by 0 The direction of the centripetal acceleration vector is always changing, to stay directed toward the center of the circle of motion. 0 This concept also applies to nonuniform circular motion or any curved path, where r is the radius of the curvature. 2 C v a r  40

21 Period 0 The period, T, is the time required for one complete revolution. 0 The speed of the particle would be the circumference of the circle of motion divided by the period. 0 Therefore, the period is 2 r T v   41   42 Q: What is the centripetal acceleration of the Earth as it moves around the Sun?
